channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: The death toll rises as rescue crews respond to Hurricane Helene's devastation
item.description: Power was out for more than 2 million customers across the Southeast and southern Appalachia on Sunday. Residents in hard-hit western North Carolina and Georgia faced water outages.
item.content:encoded:
Power was out for more than 2 million customers across the Southeast and southern Appalachia on Sunday. Residents in hard-hit western North Carolina and Georgia faced water outages.

(Image credit: Sean Rayford)
item.dc:creator: Emma Bowman

item.title: California Gov. Newsom vetoes AI safety bill that divided Silicon Valley
item.description: The measure, known as SB 1047, was one of the nation’s most far-reaching regulations on the booming AI industry. It would have held AI companies legally liable for harms caused by AI and enabled a "kill switch" if systems went rogue.
item.content:encoded:
The measure, known as SB 1047, was one of the nation’s most far-reaching regulations on the booming AI industry. It would have held AI companies legally liable for harms caused by AI and enabled a "kill switch" if systems went rogue.

(Image credit: Rich Pedroncelli/AP)
item.dc:creator: Bobby Allyn

item.title: From pager blasts to Nasrallah’s killing: 12 days that transformed a bloody conflict
item.description: NPR steps back and takes a closer look at the days leading up to the killing of Hezbollah's leader. Experts say this development has transformed an already complex and deadly conflict.
item.content:encoded:
NPR steps back and takes a closer look at the days leading up to the killing of Hezbollah's leader. Experts say this development has transformed an already complex and deadly conflict.

(Image credit: Mahmous Zayyat)
item.dc:creator: Kat Lonsdorf

item.title: The Pentagon says it wants to prevent Iran from spreading the conflict in the Middle East
item.description: After Israel killed Hezbollah's leader, the U.S. says it wants to stop Iran from "exploiting the situation or expanding the conflict."
item.content:encoded:
After Israel killed Hezbollah's leader, the U.S. says it wants to stop Iran from "exploiting the situation or expanding the conflict."

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster

item.title: IDF prepares to invade southern Lebanon as 2 more Hezbollah leaders are presumed dead
item.description: At least 11 people were killed in the latest Israeli airstrikes, according to Lebanon’s National News Agency. The Israeli military, meanwhile, says it’s preparing for a ground invasion into southern Lebanon.
item.content:encoded:
At least 11 people were killed in the latest Israeli airstrikes, according to Lebanon’s National News Agency. The Israeli military, meanwhile, says it’s preparing for a ground invasion into southern Lebanon.

(Image credit: Hassan Ammar)
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Rosman

item.title: Along Florida's Gulf Coast, residents are reeling from the effects of Hurricane Helene
item.description: The scope of the damage Hurricane Helena caused is still not totally clear.
item.content:encoded: The scope of the damage Hurricane Helena caused is still not totally clear.
item.dc:creator: Ayesha Rascoe

item.title: Should you vote your feelings? A traveling play helps audiences think that through
item.description: An acclaimed Edinburgh Fringe show encourages the audience to think about why they're voting the way they do.
item.content:encoded:
An acclaimed Edinburgh Fringe show encourages the audience to think about why they're voting the way they do.

(Image credit: Michiel Devijver)
item.dc:creator: Neda Ulaby

item.title: Getting the COVID vaccine during pregnancy protects newborns from hospitalization
item.description: Babies under six months can't be vaccinated directly against COVID. A new study found that most infants hospitalized for COVID had mothers who didn’t get the vaccine while they were pregnant.
item.content:encoded:
Babies under six months can't be vaccinated directly against COVID. A new study found that most infants hospitalized for COVID had mothers who didn’t get the vaccine while they were pregnant.

(Image credit: Gary Coronado/Los Angeles Times via Getty Imag)
item.dc:creator: Jackie Fortier

item.title: Why the U.S. government is hailing Israel's killing of Hezbollah's leader as 'justice'
item.description: Hezbollah’s leader Hassan Nasrallah was killed by Israeli airstrike on Friday. The Biden administration said it gives the victims of the Iran-backed Lebanese militant group "a measure of justice."
item.content:encoded:
Hezbollah’s leader Hassan Nasrallah was killed by Israeli airstrike on Friday. The Biden administration said it gives the victims of the Iran-backed Lebanese militant group "a measure of justice."

(Image credit: Fareed Khan)
item.dc:creator: Emma Bowman

item.title: If you want to stress less, join NPR's quest to reclaim your calm
item.description: Life can be stressful, and how you manage it is key. We have science-backed tips to help you cope. Get five weekly newsletters and a master class in stress management: Join us.
item.content:encoded: Life can be stressful, and how you manage it is key. We have science-backed tips to help you cope. Get five weekly newsletters and a master class in stress management: Join us.
item.dc:creator: Allison Aubrey
